title: All the President's Men
creator_credit: Wildwood Enterprises, Warner Bros. Pictures, William Goldman, Alan J. Pakula, George Jenkins, Carl Bernstein, Bob Woodward, Walter Coblenz, Jon Boorstin and Michael Britton
brief_description: During the 1972 elections, two reporters’ investigation sheds light on the controversial Watergate scandal that compels President Richard Nixon to resign from his post.

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

constellations_other.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_other.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.

creator_credit_for_label: Wildwood Enterprises, Warner Bros. Pictures, William Goldman, Alan J. Pakula, George Jenkins, Carl Bernstein, Bob Woodward, Walter Coblenz, Jon Boorstin and Michael Britton
description: In the run-up to the 1972 elections, Washington Post reporter Bob Woodward covers what seems to be a minor break-in at the Democratic Party National Headquarters. He is surprised to find top lawyers already on the defense case, and the discovery of names and addresses of Republican fund organizers on the accused further arouses his suspicions. After the editor of the Post runs with the story and assigns Woodward and Carl Bernstein to it, they find the trail leading higher and higher in the Republican Party—and eventually into the White House itself.
